Articles.Content:
I decided to try realism overhaul, and my game is crashing as soon as it finishes loading.  I am not sure what is causing it.

Log: https://db.tt/pqGoFyzmye

Mods:

KSP: 1.2.2 (Win32) - Unity: 5.4.0p4 - OS: Windows 10  (10.0.0) 64bit
Toolbar - 1.7.13
Advanced Jet Engine - 2.8
B9 Aerospace Procedural Parts - 0.40.11
Community Resource Pack - 0.6.6
CommunityTechTree - 3.0.3
Connected Living Space - 1.2.4.2
Contract Configurator - 1.22.2
CustomBarnKit - 1.1.12
Deadly Reentry - 7.6.0.1
Ferram Aerospace Research - 0.15.8.1
Firespitter - 7.5.1
Kerbal Construction Time - 1.3.9
Kerbal Joint Reinforcement - 3.3.2
KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.6.2
MagiCore - 1.2.5
ModularFlightIntegrator - 1.2.4
Procedural Parts - 1.2.11
RCS Build Aid - 0.9.1
RealChute - 1.4.3
RealismOverhaul - 11.5.1
RealSolarSystem - 12.0
RemoteTech - 1.8.6
RetractableLiftingSurface - 0.1.3
RSSDateTime - 1.1
Saturatable RW - 1.12
SCANsat - 1.1.6.11
Ship Manifest - 5.1.3.3
SolverEngines - 3.1
SXTContinued - 0.3.12.1
TAC Life Support - 0.13
TweakScale - 2.3.4
VenStockRevamp - 1.9.5

I'm not sure why this doesn't crash on the loading page... win32 only gives access to so much memory. Try running in win64. If this doesn't work, try uninstalling some mods and download a texture compressor. Also make sure RSS textures are no more than the middle option 4000 by 2000 I think.

Edited July 25, 2017 by AlienFromTrappist-1

On 22-7-2017 at 8:44 PM, CheckYoStaging said:

KSP: 1.2.2 (Win32) - Unity: 5.4.0p4 - OS: Windows 10  (10.0.0) 64bit

 

19 minutes ago, AlienFromTrappist-1 said:

I'm not sure why this doesn't crash on the loading page... win32 only gives access to so much memory. Try running in win64.

Clearly both of you have not bothered to look at the error.log. I've marked it in red for you. He IS using the 64bit version with plenty of RAM.
Yes, crashes like this are more often than not memory related but I do not believe this is one of them.

Quote 

Unity Player [version: Unity 5.4.0p4_b15b5ae035b7]

KSP_x64.exe caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)
  in module KSP_x64.exe at 0033:8b31e552.

Error occurred at 2017-07-22_135702.
C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP_x64.exe, run by Chris_S.
47% memory in use.
15557 MB physical memory [8158 MB free].
17885 MB paging file [8901 MB free].
134217728 MB user address space [134214578 MB free].
Read from location 00000000 caused an access violation.
error.logs aren't that helpful, what we really need is output_log.txt
Never mind, I updated my graphics drivers and closed all other applications, and now it works fine.  Thanks for the help, though.
